poem:
**Of Christmas Dinners and Borrowed Dreams**

In London's veins—  
the pulse of borrowed breath:  
£610 million whispers  
through Docklands' gray spires.  
Christmas, costly and crisp,  
swells on rising notes,  
a feast unwrapped by pounds.  
Yet in quiet corners,  
a humble plate  
is wealth untold—  
mere cranberry, a tender roast,  
truths unspoken.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cost of average UK Christmas dinner rises by 6.5%, says Kantar; Ashtead to move listing to US – business live 9.29am GMT Canary Wharf Group borrows £610m from Apollo Canary Wharf Group, which owns most of the Docklands in southeast London, has agreed to borrow £610m from US investment giant Apollo to repay bonds that fall due over the next couple of years. The proceeds will be used to repay CWG’s bonds due in April". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
